FSCS 382,Contract,"FINANCIAL SERVICES COMPENSATION SCHEME LIMITED",Awarded,2020-07-02T20:00:55Z,"Strategic Technology Partner","FSCS' 2 major IT contracts, application development/test and IT Hosting services, are coming to an end. The organisation is embarking on a new strategy for the 2020's and an ambitious programme to transform the way in which we serve our customers. Although these contracts adequately support the delivery of current operational services, the organisation needs a new strategic technology partner to meet its changing needs for the 2020's.
As a result, FSCS is looking at evolving the way to source and deliver its IT services. Our aim is to secure a strategic technology partner.

FSCS currently performs a range of functions in-house, as well as those currently outsourced. FSCS' aim, over the life of the contract, is to develop the right mix of services to be performed either in-house or to be outsourced to a partner. In determining the most appropriate approach, it will be necessary to accommodate:
- FSCS' ambition to exploit the benefits of a cloud-based environment,
- the potential replacement of our FSCS main claims technology platforms as part of our ongoing service transformation,
- FSCS' desire to embrace, where appropriate, new innovative technologies.

Potential service providers should note that this procurement is not looking to simply re-let the existing contracts but is looking for a long term 'Strategic Partner' who can support FSCS to fulfil the CIO Strategy for the future.
The scope of the services is split into 3 areas: foundation services, transformation services and future services.
FSCS requires several services to be in place, or to be available, from the start of the contract. This includes:

In order to deliver FSCS' strategic vision we recognise there are areas of our technology that require transformation. We expect the transformation to start when the contract starts, and the initial phases to be costed, but for each subsequent phase to be agreed and costed as we move through the transformation. This includes:
- selection, implementation and support of claims platform

Future services are areas of technology provision that might be moved into this contract over time but would be agreed on a case by case basis. We have laid out the potential scope of these services, so suppliers have an upfront view of what additional services might be available over the life of the contract. This includes but not limited to:

- service desk/ITSM tooling.",,,"United Kingdom,Isle of Man,Channel Islands","72000000 ","Chris Sutherland",Procurement@fscs.org.uk,"10th Floor, Beaufort House","15 St. Botolph Street",LONDON,"EC3A 7QU",England,"0207 375 8194",,,"https://ted.europa.eu/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:305297-2020:TEXT:EN:HTML ","There will be an option for FSCS to extend the contract on 2 occasions for a maximum duration of 12 months on each of those occasions, therefore making the effective service term a potential total term of 7 years.
The contract value is an estimate based on the duration including extension options.

FSCS may require the supplier to provide additional services in order to meet future changes in demands/needs or new initiatives. Any such modification shall be in the terms of Regulations 72 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015.",25/05/2020,24/05/2025,26/09/2019,YES,"FSCS 382",Yes,Yes,No,Services,40000000,,22/06/2020,40000000,"[Capgemini UK Plc

MT220053,Contract,Ofgem,Awarded,2020-07-02T17:45:13Z,"Renewable Heat Incentive Audit Programme","One of the schemes that Ofgem delivers is the Renewable Heat Incentive (RHI). The RHI is a Government financial incentive designed to encourage the uptake of renewable heat generation at all scales. The RHI is comprised of two individual schemes; one for commercial applicants (Non-Domestic RHI) and one for domestic applicants (Domestic RHI)Ofgem are responsible for administering both schemes on behalf of the Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy (BEIS). These duties include accrediting customers with eligible heating systems onto the scheme and making payments based on the amount of eligible renewable heat generated each year.The tender will set out the requirements for the technical audits of installations of for both the:-	Domestic Renewable Heat Incentive (DRHI)-	Non Domestic Renewable Heat Incentive (ND RHI)",,,"Scotland,North East,Yorkshire and the Humber,North West,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,South East,South West,Wales,Northern Ireland,Any region,London","79212000 ","Lynsey Gordon",Lynsey.Gordon@ofgem.gov.uk,"10 South Colonnade, Canary Wharf",,London,"E14 4PU",England,"+44 2079017000",http://www.ofgem.gov.uk,,"https://www.mytenders.co.uk/search/show/search_view.aspx?ID=JUL160007 ",,01/06/2020,31/05/2024,21/02/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,3915320,,30/06/2020,3915320,"[Ricardo-AEA Ltd

RM6071.,Contract,"Crown Commercial Service",Awarded,2020-07-02T11:21:26Z,"Print Marketplace","Crown Commercial Service (CCS) has established a Framework Contract with a single Supplier to provide, host and manage a system known as Print Marketplace.
• service the high-volume, low-spend print requirements across the public sector;
• enable public sector Buyers with access to a pre-qualified, dynamic and local supplier base; and
• offer real-time instant pricing across the print landscape.
The Supplier will provide a full end to end service including the management of: the system, the print
supply chain and Buyer registrations and support.
CCS has partnered with YPO to put this Framework Contract in place.

The full requirements are set out in Attachment 10 Framework Schedule 5 (Specification), in the ITT.",,,"Any region","22000000 30197630 30197640 30197643 30197645 30211300 79800000 ","The Minister for the Cabinet Office acting through Crown Commercial Service (CCS)",supplier@crowncommercial.gov.uk,"9th Floor, The Capital Building, Old Hall Street",,Liverpool,L39PP,England,"+44 3450103503",https://www.crowncommercial.gov.uk/,"OJEU Contract Notice Transparency Information for Crown Commercial Service Framework Agreement.docx Redacted Print Marketplace Framework Contract.pdf Print Marketplace Call Off Terms v1.pdf ","https://crowncommercialservice.bravosolution.co.uk/web/login.html https://ted.europa.eu/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:063410-2020:TEXT:EN:HTML ","This Framework Contract RM6071 Print Marketplace is for use by Contracting Authorities in the United Kingdom that exist on 05/02/2020 and which fall into one or more of the following categories:
(d) Non-Departmental Public Bodies (NDPBs), including advisory NDPBs, executive NDPBs, and tribunal NDPBs;

(k) Educational bodies or establishments including state schools (nursery schools, primary schools, middle or high schools, secondary schools, special schools), academies, colleges, Pupil Referral Unit (PRU), further education colleges and universities;
(n) Housing associations, including registered social landlords;
(q) Councils, including county councils, district councils, county borough councils, community councils, London borough councils, unitary councils, metropolitan
(v) Civil service bodies, including public sector buying organisations.
2. Those listed and maintained by the Government on their website at
https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations or any replacement or updated web-link
3. Those listed and maintained by the Office of National Statistics (ONS) at

NCL001-DN473216-62300484,Contract,"Newcastle University",Awarded,2020-07-01T10:08:41Z,"(NU/1575) The Supply and Delivery of a Preparative-HPLC-MS","The Centre for Bacterial Cell Biology (CBCB) at Newcastle University is the world's first major research centre with a focus on bacterial cells. The research within the centre provides scientific insight crucial for the discovery of new antibiotics, as well as solutions to industrial and environmental problems. The University requires a Preparative-High Performance Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectrometry (Prep-HPLC-MS) System, suitable to support mass guided purification of natural products from complex microbial extracts.

The scope of this contract is for the supply, delivery and installation of equipment and as detailed in Section 3 Technical Specification to the University. The contract includes after sales support and an option for a minimum of 48 months maintenance and servicing, software updates for 8 years post installation and all training necessary for safe and reliable operation of the system. This tender process is a call-off from Lot 5 of the APUC Framework Agreement for the Supply of Mass Spectrometry and Chromatography Equipment (LAB1016AP)

tender_141474/866030,Contract,"Highways England",Awarded,2020-06-30T15:16:40Z,"1-1066 Support for LTC Transition Process","The LTC project is currently supported by a long running contract referred to as the Technical Partner. This wide-ranging contract was originally set up for the development phase of the project. The activity under the Technical Partner contract is now being refocused on activities to support the main works procurement and DCO process. Highways England (HE) is aiming to procure a limited volume of specialist technical services to support HE in the transition of the LTC project from the Development phase into the Delivery Phase, where a Delivery partner as well as the Technical Partner will support HE.

The Delivery Partner contract is currently in the procurement phase. The work required under this work package will not be carried out by the Technical partner to avoid conflicts. This work package is for limited time period until the Delivery Partner for LTC is mobilised sufficiently to take over activities (expected late Q3/Q4 2020/21). In addition to supporting the transition some other services are included to support HE staff where the use of Technical Partner staff would create a conflict.",,,"Any region","73000000 ",,SPATS_Framework_Lot1@highwaysengland.co.uk,"The Cube",,Birmingham,"B1 1RN",England,,,"1-1066 AWARD LETTER - LOT 1 - TRANS.docx ",,,15/06/2020,16/12/2021,19/05/2020,NO,,No,No,No,Services,819939.92,,15/06/2020,819939.92,[Atkins

The contract will support the Monitoring and Road Investment Strategy (RIS) Compliance Division of the Strategy and Planning Directorate. The division is responsible for managing the company's compliance with our obligations as set out in the RIS, our License and Framework. It also manages the company's critical stakeholder relationships with the Department for Transport, Transport Focus and the Office of Rail and Road (ORR).",,,"Any region","73000000 ",,SPATS_Framework_Lot1@highwaysengland.co.uk,"The Cube",,Birmingham,"B1 1RN",England,,,"1-1065 AWARD LETTER - LOT 1 TRANS.docx ",,,16/06/2020,19/09/2022,12/05/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,709657.1,,16/06/2020,709657.1,[ARUP

2581/MH,Contract,"UNIVERSITY OF SHEFFIELD",Awarded,2020-06-30T14:26:46Z,"2581/MH Machining and Welding Simulation Software","The University of Sheffield is out to tender on behalf of the Nuclear Advanced Manufacturing Research Centre (NAMRC) for Machining and Welding Simulation Software.

This tender is structured in 2 Lots, one each for Machining Simulation and Welding Simulation, however the University reserves the right to award each lot to different suppliers, or both lots to a single supplier should that supplier demonstrate best value by doing so.
The full technical specification can be found in the tender documentation which will be sent to you once you have expressed your interest.
This is a non-E.U. open exercise. The ITT can be downloaded by registering and expressing your interest on the University`s e-tendering system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield.
If you have any questions or comments in relation to this tender they must be submitted via the In-tend System, this can be accessed at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield
Completed tenders must be returned through the same e-tendering system.

Closing date for receipt of tenders: Friday 26th June 2020 at 12 noon (UK time).",,"S60 5TZ",,"48100000 48323000 ","Mark Hardy",m.hardy@sheffield.ac.uk,"Western Bank",,SHEFFIELD,S102TN,England,"0114 222 4979",www.sheffield.ac.uk,,,,01/07/2020,30/06/2021,26/06/2020,YES,2581/MH,Yes,No,No,Products,50000,150000,29/06/2020,51606,"[MSC Software Ltd

Project Manager,Contract,"DIGITAL CATAPULT SERVICES LIMITED",Awarded,2020-06-29T18:25:44Z,"Project Manager","Digital Catapult is looking for a Project Manager to manage delivery of a number of Digital Catapult projects, working closely with colleagues across business development, product, technology, marketing and finance.
These projects will be with commercial partners or as part of consortia funded as collaborative R&D activities through grants or internally funded projects.
Our philosophy is to manage the planning, initiation and delivery of these projects using agile or waterfall methodologies as needed and focus on impact & clear economic outcomes for the UK.
Hands-on project management experience in a technical setting, managing multiple stakeholders
Direct experience managing agile and waterfall projects, including methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban, Agile certifications or PRINCE2 an advantage
Knowledge of project management tools such as Jira, SmartSheets and MS Project
Experience in delivering cross-functional projects in a matrix organisation structure
Pro-active and self-confident, adaptable to ambiguity, change and evolving priorities with excellent communication and people skills
Comfortable with delivering both fast-paced short-term projects as well as slower-paced long term projects
For full details and how to apply, please follow the link below. Please note that no applications will be considered unless received using the link provided.

https://www.digicatapult.org.uk/careers/a2S3Y00000Jty21UAB",,,"United Kingdom","72224000 ",,Human.Resources@digicatapult.org.uk,"101 Euston Road",,LONDON,NW12RA,England,,https://www.digicatapult.org.uk,,,"For more details and how to apply, please follow the link below.

DVNCC001-DN444048-04451129,Contract,"Devon County Council",Awarded,2020-06-29T00:00:00Z,"CP1828A-19 SW Exeter HIF - A379 Eastern Junction","The overall objective of this scheme is to improve the accessibility of the A379 for all type of users: pedestrians, cyclists and motorists, between the Devon Hotel roundabout and the Sannerville Way roundabout, Exeter, prior to major development planned to the south west of Exeter. (UK Ordnance Survey grid reference SX 93217 89154). At present, this section of the A379 is a 4-lane single carriageway with limited facilities for pedestrians/cyclists. There are no crossing facilities near the Sannerville Way roundabout and a narrow shared use path on the south side of this road. The proposal seeks to introduce a new toucan crossing on the approach to the Sannerville Way roundabout to connect the south side of the A379 with the existing shared use path on Bridge Road and Matford Marsh. The existing shared use path on the A379 will also be widened where possible. Furthermore, a new signalised junction will be created with a new side road to the south of the A379 which will provide access to the proposed development area. The elements of work included in this phase of the scheme are, but not limited to: • Site Clearance • Earthworks • Drainage Works • Introduction of a staggered toucan crossing. • Modification and widening, where possible, of the existing shared use paths. • Realignment of the carriageway. • Resurfacing of the carriageway. • Road markings and signage. • Introduction of a new signalised junction. • Introduction of a new side road with shared paths and a staggered toucan crossing. • Removal of a layby. • Vehicle Restraint System Barriers • Street lighting electrical works. • Landscaping works.
Bidders should be aware from the outset that the maximum budget available for this contract is £2.6m.  Bidders who submit a bid over this amount will be rejected.

The procurement documents are available for unrestricted and full direct access, free of charge, at: http://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk Tenders or requests to participate must be submitted electronically via: http://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk. Time limit for receipt of tenders or requests to participate: Date: 18/05/2020 Local time: 12:00

SOUTHWARK-DN454228-80443126,Contract,"London Borough of Southwark",Awarded,2020-06-26T15:23:24Z,"The decarbonising of Southwark District Heating Plantrooms","Southwark Council will shortly be using our Major Works framework (Lot 3 - Heating) to procure a main D&B contractor for the installation of commercial scale aquifer fed heat pumps in a small number of our district boiler houses. A feasibility study of five sites was carried out by Calford Seaden with specialist input provided by ICAX on the hydrogeological assessment side. As a result of the feasibility, two sites have been discounted leaving three that were deemed technically and financially viable - Consort, Newington and Wyndham.

All main contractors on Lot 3 of the framework were invited to attend an information day and site visit in September, which included some background information on the project at that stage and the chance to see an aquifer based water source heat pump in action at the London South Bank University.

PROC LSB ITT/1251 - AWARD,Contract,"The University of Nottingham",Awarded,2020-06-26T07:55:26Z,"Industrial Robots for The Future Automated Aerospace Assembly Demonstrator Phase 2 (FA3D2) Concept - AWARD","The Centre for Aerospace Manufacturing (CAM) at the University Of Nottingham (UoN) works with partners from across the UK and European aerospace industry to deliver industrially focused research into aerospace assembly systems.

Advanced manufacturing is a key research priority area for Nottingham and the University has invested significantly in this research. The University made a strategic investment in automated assembly infrastructure through the Future Automated Aerospace Assembly Demonstrator (FA3D) project, which was commissioned in 2016. Based on the success of this project, funding has been secured from the UK Government's Industrial Strategy Challenge Fund (ISCF) through the Aerospace Technology Institute (ATI) for development of the second phase of this demonstrator.

The Future Automated Aerospace Assembly Demonstrator Phase 2 (FA3D2) will  provide an opportunity for UK based aerospace manufacturing businesses to test, demonstrate and accelerate the implementation of novel breakthrough technologies, thus allowing them to compete on productivity, quality and cost with rival offshore businesses.",,"NG7 2RN","Any region","42997300 ","Leanne Bryant",bbzlsb@exmail.nottingham.ac.uk,"Lenton Lane",Nottingham,Nottinghamshire,"NG7 2RN","United Kingdom",01159513635,,,,,01/07/2020,30/06/2021,04/05/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Products,0,,23/06/2020,192087,"[FANUC UK Ltd

SWALE001-DN477834-14196574,Contract,"Swale Borough Council",Awarded,2020-06-26T00:00:00Z,"Stray Dog Kennelling and Rehoming","Swale Borough Council is inviting Expressions of Interest to tender for a Stray Dog Kennelling Contract.

The contract will commence on Wednesday, 01 July 2020 and terminate on Friday, 30 June 2023.  The Council may extend this opportunity for a further one year.  The tenderer/s who submit/s the Most Economically Advantageous Tender, (MEAT) will be awarded the contract.

The contract will involve providing licensed facilities for the reception and boarding and rehoming of stray dogs for the statutory 7-day period, although this may be shorter for claimed dogs, and for a period following the statutory period where the kennels do not wish to re-home a dog. Swale BC officers will require access to the kennels from 09.00 until 22.00 hours, seven days a week, excluding Christmas Day, Boxing Day and Easter Sunday.
Expressions of Interest and Invitation to Tender (I.T.T.) must be submitted / uploaded on the Council's e-tendering portal.
The closing date for submission of Expressions of Interest and the closing date for the I.T.T. is 14/06/2020 23:59.

This is an open tender for the supply of biomass fuel meeting the specification in the contract and meeting the requirements of the contract, to be delivered to the fuel depot(s) at the following sites:
Site 1: Leicestershire County Council, County Hall, Championship Way, Glenfield, Leicestershire, LE3 8RE;
Site 2: Hinckley Parks Primary School, Leicester Road, Hinckley, LE10 1LP.

UK Biobank researchers have previously downloaded data for analysis within their own environment. PLYM001-DN481165-49833687,Contract,"Plymouth City Council",Awarded,2020-06-25T00:00:00Z,"Intensive School Cycle Engagement (Cycling & Scooting) Service","Plymouth City Council (""the Council"") has successfully secured funding from the Department for Transport's (DfT) Access Fund for Sustainable Travel Revenue Competition. The funding allows the continuation of delivery of Plymotion the Council's successful behavioural change programme (www.plymouth.gov.uk/plymotion).

The focus of Plymotion is on workplaces, schools, and new developments in key growth areas of the city. Through Plymotion we will support businesses, schools and residents in new developments to walk, cycle and use the bus for regular journeys they make.
The Council is therefore seeking quotations for the provision of an Intensive School Engagement (Cycling and Scooting) Service.

The Authority is providing two tender options for the tender submission: Tender A (essential works) and Tender B (Option A+B (desirable works)) for works depending upon capital investment required. Suppliers are expected to provide a price for both tender options.

2502/JS,Contract,"UNIVERSITY OF SHEFFIELD",Awarded,2020-06-23T12:26:59Z,"Compound Microscope","The University of Sheffield requires a Compound Microscope to form part of the build of a fluorescence microscope for the purpose of imaging proteins or protein aggregates at 'single molecule resolution' in solutions, cells and sectioned tissue (with light sheet imaging in Epi mode) in 3D and which also allows us to perform localisation based super-resolution microscopy (like STORM, DNA-PAINT etc) in 2D in (using total internal reflection mode)

We would like to build this set-up using an inverted motorised microscope body with very high flexibility, equipped with high-numerical aperture objective (to study at high resolution), an auto-focus system (allows long time experiment without any drift) and an automated stage (to image image multiple regions of the samples).
To compliment the Compound Microscope multiple lasers (4 different colours) and a highly sensitive camera will be purchased separately and added by the University.
In the near future we will add new optical modules in such a way that we can do label free imaging of single proteins.
This is an non-EU open exercise.
The ITT can be downloaded by registering and expressing your interest on the University`s e-tendering system https://intendhost.co.uk/Sheﬃeld.
If you have any questions or comments in relation to this tender they must be submitted via the In-tend System, this can be accessed at https://intendhost.co.uk/Sheﬃeld.
Completed tenders must be returned through the same e-tendering system.

Closing date for receipt of tenders: Thursday 9th April 2020 at 12 noon (UK time).",,,"Yorkshire and the Humber","38510000 ","Jamie Shaw",jamie.shaw@sheffield.ac.uk,"Western Bank",,SHEFFIELD,S102TN,England,,,,"https://intendhost.co.uk/Sheﬃeld ","All tender documents are available at:

column1: QU322 - AWARD,Contract,"Birmingham City Council",Awarded,2020-06-23T00:17:56Z,"QU322 - Provision for support, advice and management of international and national public health food projects  - AWARD","Birmingham City Council is seeking a supplier for the provision of support, advice and management of international and national public health food projects.

We want Birmingham to be a city where every citizen can eat an affordable, safe, healthy diet, enjoys their food with occasional treats, and knows that the food they eat is ethical and environmentally sustainable.

We want Birmingham to be a city where the food economy is vibrant and reflects the diversity of our communities and is financially successful and sustainable contributing to a circular economy for food which reduces waste, minimises environmental harm and maximises the local assets of the city and west midlands region.

Birmingham Public Health requires the services of an organisation with proven knowledge and experience in the area of food policy, to provide specialist support and advice across the evolving work programme.
The successful organisation will also manage and support Birmingham City Council's existing international and national level food projects and partnerships such as:

o Milan Urban Food Policy Pact - an international partnership for action on creating healthy food environments in cities and towns. The partnership enables connection with a network of 206 cities across the world to share learning on approaches to food in urban environments.
o BINDI Nutrition Smart Cities partnership with Pune, India - a learning partnership for developing policies and practises with a view to becoming Nutrition Smart Cities
o Delice - an international network focussing on the economic development and cultural approach to food including:
o how cities can preserve and showcase their food heritage
o how cities can attract qualitative food entrepreneurs that will offer a qualitative food scene to citizens and visitors
o how cities can bring sustainability to their food sector and push local food consumption
o Childhood Obesity Trailblazer - a council-led project in England to tackle childhood obesity at a local level, with a focus on inequalities. It aims to:
o test the limits of existing powers through innovative and determined action to tackle childhood obesity
o share learning and best practice to encourage wider local action
o develop solutions to local obstacles and consider further actions government can take to enable ambitious local action and achieve change at scale
This contract will be for a period of 2 years commencing 1 June 2020 until 31 May 2022 with an option to extend for a further 12 months subject to satisfactory performance.

The Council will be using its free to use e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and potential suppliers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity please click on the following link to access https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your deta...",,"B4 7WB","West Midlands","75122000 85312310 85000000 75110000 80561000 98000000 85311300 79342000 75131000 85323000 72224000 98133000 98334000 98132000 85100000 85140000 98110000 ","Manjit Samrai",manjit.samrai@birmingham.gov.uk,"10 Woodcock Street",Birmingham,"West Midlands","B4 7WB","United Kingdom","0121 303 0349",,,,,01/07/2020,30/06/2022,22/04/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,0,,17/06/2020,175943,"[Food Foundation, Raincloud

SHEPWAY001-DN466464-59285828,Contract,"Folkestone and Hythe District Council",Awarded,2020-06-23T00:00:00Z,"Provision of End Point Assessments","Folkestone & Hythe District Council (FHDC) is a Registered Apprenticeship Training Provider (RoATP), offering apprenticeships to its own staff as well as partner organisations and other local businesses.\r
The Council currently have around 70 apprentices registered, spread across five cohorts, who will be completing their qualifications between April 2020 and April 2021.\r

As part of the apprenticeship delivery, all apprentices are required to pass through an End Point Assessment (EPA) at the conclusion of their studies. This is in order to achieve their apprenticeship. \r
The Council is therefore seeking to engage the services of an experienced and qualified EPAO in order to carry out its EPAs.\r
This opportunity is published on Kent Business Portal, to access please visit the portal's webpage https://www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk/ . Registration is required, if not already registered\r

OXF001-DN454413-72133392,Contract,"Oxford City Council",Awarded,2020-06-23T00:00:00Z,"Provision of Estate Agency Services to Oxford City Housing Limited (OCHL)","Oxford City Housing Ltd (OCHL) is undertaking this procurement process to secure up to 3 (as a maximum) suppliers to provide Estate Agency Services for its 'New Homes' development programme. Oxford City Housing Ltd (OCHL) was set up in 2016 and is enabling the City Council to directly deliver social rented housing alongside the provision of shared ownership and private units which cross subsidise the social rented units. OCHL has therefore launched the Council into the shared ownership and private sales new homes market in Oxford City, for which they require Estate Agency Services throughout the development process through to off plan and completed unit sales.

The initial tranche of work will be 7 such new housing developments which are at (or very close to) delivery stage. They comprise a mix of shared ownership, private sale homes, and social rented homes. There are an additional 8 sites currently at the planning and feasibility stage - as a 'medium term' pipeline - with a list of further sites being considered longer term.

column1: STK001-DN408438-52071169,Contract,"Tees Valley Combined Authority",Awarded,2020-06-22T00:00:00Z,"Tees Valley Hydrogen Transport Initiative - Refuelling Infrastructure Deployment - Phase 1","TVCA is a partnership of five local authorities in North East England which aims to drive economic growth in the region. As part of a new low carbon industrial strategy, TVCA is seeking to catalyse the roll-out of zero emission vehicles and associated infrastructure that will provide environmental and economic development benefits to the region. An early focus of this initiative is to establish a basic network of hydrogen refuelling stations (HRS), as part of a phased approach to creating an expanding hydrogen transport cluster in the North of England. The first phase of the project involves installation of two HRS in the area, along with the deployment of a small fleet of fuel cell electric vehicles (FCEVs). Instructions to Suppliers: Please be advised that Tees Valley Combined Authority are conducting this procurement via the NEPO Portal (Pro-Contract) www.nepoportal.org. You will need to register as a supplier on the site (registration is free) and search for Tees Valley Combined Authority/ Stockton Borough Council within the Contract Opportunities section. Once your expression of interest has been received, immediate access to the tender documentation is granted, (accessible via My Opportunities page) for the person who expressed the interest.",,,"North East","09120000 ","Mandy Dixon",mandy.dixon@teesvalley-ca.gov.uk,"Cavendish House","Teesdale Business Park",Stockton-on-Tees,"TS17 6QY","United Kingdom","+44 1642526118",http://www.teesvalley-ca.gov.uk,,,,29/07/2019,31/03/2024,24/05/2019,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Works,2800000,2800000,22/06/2020,2240053,"[Logan Energy

BOURN001-DN459084-44248681,Contract,"Bournemouth Christchurch and Poole Council",Awarded,2020-06-22T00:00:00Z,"Design, supply and install play equipment in Poole Park","BCP Council is seeking an experienced play supplier to design, supply and install exciting and bespoke new play areas for Poole Park, which is a Grade II Listed Park and Garden and sits within a Conservation Area. A grant of £2.7m has been secured from the National Lottery Heritage Fund as part of total funding of £3.5m to improve Poole Park. This contract, with a fixed value of £320,000, will deliver one of the key outcomes of the Poole Park Life project.

BCP Council want to create destination play facilities that attract families from a wide area, support healthy lifestyles, enhance community use and the social value of the park, increase footfall and support secondary spend.

,,,South West","37535220 37535200 45236210 ","Strategic Procurement Team",procurement@bcpcouncil.gov.uk,"Bournemouth Christchurch and Poole Council","Town Hall",Bournemouth,"BH2 6DY",England,"+44 1202633266",https://www.bcpcouncil.gov.uk,,,"Suppliers interested in this opportunity can access the full procurement documentation by visiting BCP Council's Tendering system www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk

Suppliers should search for the opportunity through Supplying the South West. There are further details of the opportunity on the advert published on www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk and instructions on how suppliers can access the procurement documentation for completion.
Responses to the opportunity must be submitted electronically through www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk before the deadline shown on the system.
If you are unable to access the advert for the opportunity through www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk please contact the Council using the contact details provided.

BIP502018588,Contract,"Bedfordshire Fire and Rescue Authority",Awarded,2020-06-21T08:30:07Z,"Provision of a Replacement Integrated Communication Control System and Mobilising Solution","Bedfordshire Fire and Rescue Service, trading as Bedfordshire Fire and Rescue Authority (the 'Authority'), is inviting expressions of interest from organisations wishing to enter into a contract for the design, implementation, installation and maintenance of a replacement integrated communication control system and mobilising solution.

tender_230215/863780,Contract,"West Midlands Combined Authority",Awarded,2020-06-19T13:54:54Z,"Adult Education Budget (AEB) 2 Service Contract Award","WMCA is establishing a suite of Adult Education Budget Service Contracts through this procurement exercise, with a total estimated value of up to £4m for the initial 15 month period. It is WMCA's intention that contracts awarded will initially be awarded for 15 months (academic year 2019 to 2020), with an option to extend for a further year up to July 2022. The value of the contract extension is still to be confirmed.
WMCA has split this procurement activity into three Lots:
Lot 4 - Support for those in Employment
- Focus on new learning to support career progression
- A flexible adult offer to enable those who seek to re-train and up-skill
- Particular focus but not exclusive to those in low-paid, low-skilled and insecure jobs
- Funding subsidies available to support L3 and L4
- Pre-apprenticeship provision that supports uptake of Apprenticeships
- Particular focus on young people aged between 19 and 30 and unemployed adults aged 30+ through level 3 provision
- Technical skills at level 3 supporting event management, digital marketing, hospitality, sports coaching and team leading.

Focus on creative, digital and tourism to prepare those individuals not working in the city least likely to have the skills, confidence or access to the programmes the city of culture trust, will be running (including volunteering, apprenticeships and events-based jobs). The development delivered through these programmes should move individual to the point where they are able to access and compete for opportunities created as a result of the City of Culture.

One of the potential outcomes that individuals may be prepared to access is the ""city hosts"" programme - a crew of 5,000 individuals trained to provide the best possible welcome to the city for visitors. This, alongside apprenticeships and events related jobs in hospitality, production, sales, customer service, event management, security and tourism sectors are the type of opportunities that people should be supported to access.

Bidders can submit proposals for as many lots as they wish. For completeness, it should be noted that the lots in this tender opportunity are listed from 4 - 6. The reason for the lot numbering is to follow on from the award of lots 1-3 from the first AEB tender round that was undertaken in 2019.",,,"West Midlands","80000000 ","West Midlands Combined Authority",procurement.team@wmca.org.uk,"16 Summer Lane",,Birmingham,"B19 3SD",England,,,,,,01/06/2020,31/07/2021,06/03/2020,YES,tender_230215/831583,Yes,Yes,No,Services,189000,,18/06/2020,4000000,"[WALTHAM INTERNATIONAL COLLEGE LIMITED

column1: tender_234193/863593,Contract,capitalEsourcing,Awarded,2020-06-19T13:32:39Z,"Vehicle Relocations Service","A vehicle relocation service for the movement of vehicles from street to street within the boundaries of Westminster City Council. The service requirement includes;
One dedicated Relocation Vehicle within the Westminster City Council area Monday -Saturday between the core hours, 08:30 - 14:30

Outside of these core hours, a service on demand as and when required, 24 hours per day, 365 days a year, within 2 hours (between the hours of 2.30pm - 6.30pm Monday - Saturday) and 4 hours at all other times to be within the Westminster City Council area.
Relocation of Designated Vehicle to the nearest available paid-for-parking bay as identified by the Named Driver
Relocation of resident permit holders' vehicles to alternative resident bay spaces.
An extra Dedicated Relocation Vehicle to support relocations for special events and operations

The contract is for 1 year with the option to extend for up to 10 months. Tthe contract value for the initial term will be up to £120,000 and up to £100,000 for the extension period of 10 months bringing the total contract value to £220,000.",,"SW1E 6QP",London,"34144220 60182000 ",,oakinmade@westminster.gov.uk,"Procurement & Commercial Services, Westminster City Council, 64 Victoria Street",,London,"SW1E 6QP",England,,www.westminster.gov.uk,,,,04/07/2020,03/07/2021,18/06/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,120000,220000,17/06/2020,120000,"[D H Mansfield Limited

column1: SHEPWAY001-DN477705-57740055,Contract,"Folkestone and Hythe District Council",Awarded,2020-06-19T00:00:00Z,"EXTERNAL DECORATIONS & ASSOCIATED REPAIRS","A Suitable Contractor is required for the provision of a programme of external repairs and decoration/re-decoration of external surfaces and internal common parts for the Councils properties. The works are to be carried out as specified in the accompanying technical specifications.

The works may involve extensive preparations and general building repairs prior to re-decorating.  The estimated proportion of the budget to be spent against each property for pre-decoration repairs and decorations works is:
The type of repairs that is likely to be required as a pre-decorating requisite may include but not be limited to:
-	Replacement of flooring (all types including liquid applied)

The works shall be undertaken over a 5 year term with the project estimated to start Summer 2020 and must be completed by no later than 31st April 2025.  The budget for each financial year is to be utilised fully within that particular financial year.

NB: The first year of the programme is expected to run from August 2020 and complete by 31st March 2020.  All subsequent programmes will have the full financial year, 1st April to 31st March for programme delivery.

The opportunity is available on Kent Business Portal and can be accessed via the portal's webpage, https://www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk/. Registration is required and free for those not already registered.

BHM20-22 - AWARD,Contract,"Birmingham City Council",Awarded,2020-06-16T23:48:31Z,"BHM20-22 - Birmingham Black History Month (BHM) Co-ordinator  - AWARD","Birmingham City Council (the Council) requires a supplier to provide services for the coordination of Birmingham Black History Month.

Black History Month (BHM) was first celebrated in the United Kingdom in 1987. Since then, the month of October has been dedicated to raising awareness of and celebrating our Black History through cultural events and activities.  BHM is part of the Council's annual festivals and events programme which is overseen by the Cultural Development Service.

This contract will be for a period of 31 months anticipated commencing 22nd May 2020 until 30 November 2022 with Black History Month taking place during the month of October each year. The contract period includes preparation time prior to Black History Month, as well as a period for evaluation until the end of November for each delivery year.
The following services will be required from the successful supplier in respect of Birmingham's 2020 to 2022 Black History Month:

o develop, create content, produce and distribute a BHM brochure plus market the brochure via social media through a range of online platforms, ensuring that brochures are produced and distributed by beginning of September per year of this contract

o liaise with and coordinate BHM programming with other Birmingham institutions such as universities in Birmingham, to ensure all BHM activities are programmed throughout October effectively and to avoid events and activities running concurrently where possible.
o communicate a BHM diversity profile to encourage new audiences to engage with BHM themed events with cultural and grassroots organisations and residents
o ensure BHM adds to the cultural offer for city residents, particularly focusing on Black arts leadership roles and a diverse arts workforce
o help celebrate and focus attention on the development of the Commonwealth Games cultural programme. https://www.birmingham2022.com/
o ensure BHM supports the Cultural Strategy including the Creative Future and Culture on Our Doorstep strategic pledges
o Obtain additional funding via fundraising and sponsorship to support delivery of BHM for each year of this contract
o provide ongoing support for all marketing and communication of partner events to maximise attendance at all planned activities in the city of Birmingham.
o provide professional feedback and evaluation on the marketing of BHM to inform future BHM coordinator roles
o liaise with the Cultural Development Service throughout the role and achieve performance targets to trigger payment lines as will be set out in the contract awarded to the successful applicant

o develop, coordinate, administer and deliver an annual BHM launch event at the end of September and beginning of October for each year of this contract with a focus on celebrating the lead up to the Commonwealth Games and cultural programme

o produce an artistic program in partnership with arts practitioners for the launch eve...",,"B4 7WB","West Midlands","79952000 79952100 79342000 22100000 22150000 79413000 ","Manjit Samrai",manjit.samrai@birmingham.gov.uk,"10 Woodcock Street",Birmingham,"West Midlands","B4 7WB","United Kingdom","0121 303 0349",,,,,18/06/2020,31/12/2022,12/05/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,0,,16/06/2020,60000,"[Blackstory Partnership
column2: 94 Wolverhampton Road, Oldbury , West Mids, United Kingdom, B68 0LW

column1: Head Office 00000150 - AWARD,Contract,"L&Q Construction",Awarded,2020-06-16T16:26:58Z,"London and Quadrant Housing Trust - Sustainability Consultant Framework 2020 - 2024 - AWARD","London and Quadrant Housing Trust and its subsidiary Quadrant Construction Services are one of the largest providers of affordable housing in the UK, housing over 250,000 people in more than 95,000 homes, primarily across London and the South East of England. London and Quadrant Housing Trust are tendering for the provision of Sustainability Consultants for London and Quadrant's Self Delivered New Build Projects to comply with the Public Contracts regulations 2015. The objective of this tender process is to establish a Framework Agreement with the tenderers and London and Quadrant Housing Trust. The dates and contract value are estimates and could be subject to change. This is tender is for Service providers only.
This is a two stage tender and both stages adhere to the time-scales as prescribed within the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 for Restricted OJEU Tenders.
Click on the 'Express Interest' Button at the bottom
Click on the 'Selection Stage' Tab at the top
- Scroll to the bottom of the screen and you will be able to view the Tender Documents and access the Standard Selection Questionnaire
- For the Selection Stage you will only need to submit the Standard Selection Questionnaire
- We will score your questionnaire and will advise you as to whether you are successful or not
- Pricing Documents will only be available to those who have passed the Selection Stage
ONLY IF YOU HAVE PASSED THE SELECTION STAGE
- Scroll to the bottom and you will be able to access the Tender Documents
- Tenderers will be briefed as to what they will need to submit for this tender
Please allow sufficient time to submit your return by the specified dates as late returns will not be permitted.

Under the Framework Agreement L&Q and all companies within the L&Q Group (including, without limitation, Quadrant Construction Services) will have the option to call-off contracts with individual framework contractors as and when required. In addition, other Social Housing Providers in the UK (both those that are in existence now and those that may be in existence in the future) will also be entitled to call-off contracts under the Framework Agreement. ""Social Housing Provider"" for this purpose means any provider of social housing and includes, without limitation, Registered Providers, Local Authorities and ALMOs. Such Social Housing Providers will only be entitled to call off under the Framework Agreement if L&Q consents.

For information regarding this tender please contact the Framework Team via the tender portal. This tender is managed by the Framework Buying department. Please do not contact any other department within the London and Quadrant Group. Please do not contact Group Procurement for information as this Tender has been created by the Framework Buying Department.",,"E15 4PH","Any region","71530000 71313400 79411100 79419000 79400000 ","Amy Crow",ACrow@lqgroup.org.uk,"West Ham Lane",Stratford,London,"E15 4PH",England,"0300 456 9998",www.quadrant-construction.co.uk,,,,30/06/2020,30/06/2024,11/05/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,189000,,16/06/2020,189000,"[Atkins Limited

column1: SCC 533 - AWARD,Contract,"Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council",Awarded,2020-06-16T09:24:31Z,"Ice Cream and Slush Concessions 2020-2023 - AWARD","Ice Cream and Slush Concessions 2020-2023

Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council is inviting tender submissions from responsible and suitable operators to trade ice cream, slush, candy floss, confectionary and soft drinks only at a number of designated locations across Sandwell Valley Country Park and on Dartmouth Park play area. The Council is seeking to appoint a single provider for the provision of this service. Designated locations are listed in the specification.
The concession will be for 3 years from 1st April 2020 to 31st March 2023.
Operators will provide a cost for the concessions and price will be awarded on the bidder whose proposal represents the highest bid.
To appoint a single provider for the provision of the Ice cream and Slush Concessions 2020-2023.
The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to the ITT and other related documents.
In Order To View the On-Line Questionnaire and Submit a Tender, you will be required to` Opt-In`.

For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810.

tender_229700/861827,Contract,"Public Health England",Awarded,2020-06-11T13:25:29Z,"PHE - 190022 - Site Cold Water Tanks - Expressions of interest","PHE are looking for expressions of interest in the project described below. Please note that you will need to express an interest through PHE.Bravo and complete the details requested. The ITT will be by invitation only to those that have expressed an interest and then signed a Confidentiality Disclosure Agreement (CDA).

The project is to carry out the supply, installation, testing and commissioning of new storage tanks complete with pump sets to provide a resilient, constant pressure cold water supply at the main Porton site. Modifications to the existing distribution system will be required at the east and west end of the site in order to provide a circulation for water. At some stage during the project a new dedicated incoming water main will be installed to connect to the new tanks. The project shall be let as a complete package and shall include all necessary preparatory work together with the required telemetry, chlorination and water analyses.",,"SP4 0JG","Any region","44611500 45213210 45231112 51000000 ",,Gary.Topley@phe.gov.uk,"PHE Manor Farm Road",,Salisbury,"SP4 0JG",England,,,,"https://phe.bravosolution.co.uk ","
